Engineering Excellence

Creating Innovative Metformin Products.

Metformin

What is Metformin?

Currently, over 150 million people worldwide are using metformin.

Metformin: Effective First-Line Treatment for Type 2 Diabetes with Common Gastrointestinal Side Effects

Metformin is the most common drug used and is the first-line agent in type 2 diabetes management. It is also considered one of the safest pharmacological agents for the treatment of the disease.

However, gastrointestinal side effects are common, occurring in up to 75% of those who take metformin (2). These side effects may include diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, abdominal discomfort, and/or flatulence, with severity ranging from mild to severe. These complications are more common with immediate-release preparations of metformin than with its extended-release formulation. Discontinuation and nonadherence rates have been as high as 46% with metformin because of these issues (3).

Metformin's benefits may extend far beyond diabetes

Discontinuation and nonadherence rates have been as high as 46% with metformin because of these issues (3).

Products

Our products include different configurations and formulations of Metformin.

We offer Metformin in both effervescent liquid and lozenge form.

Crystalized Metformin

Our effervescent version of Metformin provides a sachet of Metformin crystals that, when mixed with water, provides a drinkable solution for taking Metformin. The Metformin crystals come in different flavor options.

Learn more

Metformin Gummies

Our gummy version of Metformin is as simple as if one were eating a gummy candy. The gummies are infused with Metformin and provide an easier option for patients who struggle with swallowing pills or related side effects.

Learn more

Enhancements

In addition to our base versions of Crystalized Metformin and Metformin Gummies.

We offer enhancements for patients with specific needs and requirements.

We offer a Metformin + Vitamin B12 product

Because patients who take Metformin over extended periods of time show Vitamin B12 deficiencies,
